Signals¶

bhp_sync uses signals to:

  • package a new or modified model instance into an outgoing transaction.
  • extract and save a new or modified model instance from in an incoming transaction.

Signals are listening for:

  • any model instance that is a base class of class BaseSyncModel (post_save())
  • any new instance of bhp_sync.models.IncomingTransaction (post_save())

Models with the base class BaseSyncModel¶

Outgoing transactions are created when models with the base class BaseSyncModel are added or edited. When a model instance is saved the post_save() signal calls serialize_on_save(). For models that have a models.ManyToManyField, the serialize_m2m_on_save() is also called.

The methods called during the post_save() signal, serialize_on_save() and serialize_m2m_on_save(), are wrappers for bhp_sync.classes.SerializeToTransaction.

bhp_sync.classes.SerializeToTransaction packages the model instance as a transaction saved to bhp_sync.models.OutgoingTransaction.

Transaction Models¶

deserialize_on_post_save() is called by the post_save() signal on instances of bhp_sync.models.IncomingTransaction.
